briefdescription.para: Device is closed, but must be open.
A channel group must be specified.
Status/error codes returned by libsigrok functions.
Ternary return type for DMM/LCR/etc packet parser validity checks.
The trigger matched at this point in the data feed.

detaileddescription.para: No payload.
No payload.
No payload.
on/off ratio.

briefdescription.para: Electrical power, usually in W, or dBm.
Gain (a transistor's gain, or hFE, for example).
Logarithmic representation of sound pressure relative to a reference value.
Unit of conductance, the inverse of resistance.
An absolute measurement of power, in decibels, referenced to 1 milliwatt (dBm).
Voltage in decibel, referenced to 1 volt (dBV).
Measurements that intrinsically do not have units attached, such as ratios, gains, etc.

detaileddescription.para: Specifically, a transistor's gain (hFE) is a unitless quantity, for example.

briefdescription.para: Sound pressure level, in decibels, relative to 20 micropascals.
Normalized (0 to 1) concentration of a substance or compound with 0 representing a concentration of 0%, and 1 being 100%.

detaileddescription.para: This is represented as the fraction of number of particles of the substance.

briefdescription.para: Wind speed in meters per second.
Relative humidity assuming air temperature of 293 Kelvin (rF).
Plane angle in 1/360th of a full circle.
Mass in tael (variants: Hong Kong, Singapore/Malaysia, Taiwan)
This is a true RMS measurement.
Value is voltage drop across a diode, or NAN.
Device is in "hold" mode (repeating the last measurement).
Device is in "max" mode, only updating upon a new max value.
Device is in "min" mode, only updating upon a new min value.
Sound pressure level is A-weighted in the frequency domain, according to IEC 61672:2003.
Sound pressure level is C-weighted in the frequency domain, according to IEC 61672:2003.

detaileddescription.para: not at all) in the frequency domain, according to IEC 61672:2003.

briefdescription.para: Sound pressure level is not weighted in the frequency domain, albeit without standards-defined low and high frequency limits.
Sound pressure level measurement is S-weighted (1s) in the time domain.
Sound pressure level measurement is F-weighted (125ms) in the time domain.
Sound pressure level is time-averaged (LAT), also known as Equivalent Continuous A-weighted Sound Level (LEQ).
Sound pressure level represented as a percentage of measurements that were over a preset alarm level.
Time is duration (as opposed to epoch, ...).
Device is in "avg" mode, averaging upon each new value.

detaileddescription.para: Kelvin connection).

briefdescription.para: If set, this output module writes the output itself.
The device can act as logic analyzer.
The device can act as an oscilloscope.
The device can act as a multimeter.
The device is a demo device.
The device can act as a sound level meter.
The device can measure energy consumption.
The device can act as a signal demodulator.
The device can act as a programmable power supply.
The device can act as an LCR meter.
The device can act as an electronic load.
The device can act as a scale.
The device can act as a function generator.
Specification on how to connect to a device.

detaileddescription.para: In combination with SR_CONF_SERIALCOMM, this is a serial port in the form which makes sense to the OS (e.g., /dev/ttyS0). Otherwise this specifies a USB device, either in the form of <bus>.<address> (decimal, e.g. 1.65) or <vendorid>.<productid> (hexadecimal, e.g. 1d6b.0001).

briefdescription.para: Serial communication specification, in the form:

detaileddescription.para: Example: 9600/8n1
The string may also be followed by one or more special settings, in the form "/key=value". Supported keys and their values are:
rts 0,1 set the port's RTS pin to low or high dtr 0,1 set the port's DTR pin to low or high flow 0 no flow control 1 hardware-based (RTS/CTS) flow control 2 software-based (XON/XOFF) flow control
This is always an optional parameter, since a driver typically knows the speed at which the device wants to communicate.
This is always an optional parameter, since a driver typically knows the default slave address of the device.

briefdescription.para: User specified forced driver attachment to unknown devices.

detaileddescription.para: By design the interpretation of the string depends on the specific driver. It typically would be either a replacement '*IDN?' response value, or a sub-driver name. But could also be anything else and totally arbitrary.

briefdescription.para: The device supports setting its samplerate, in Hz.
The device supports setting a pre/post-trigger capture ratio.
The device supports setting a pattern (pattern generator mode).
The device supports setting trigger slope.
The device supports setting number of samples to be averaged over.
The device supports setting its sample interval, in ms.
Number of horizontal divisions, as related to SR_CONF_TIMEBASE.
Number of vertical divisions, as related to SR_CONF_VDIV.
The device supports using an external clock.

detaileddescription.para: Typical this is between buffered and unbuffered channels.
The input signal is downmixed by this frequency before the ADC anti-aliasing filter.

briefdescription.para: The device supports setting the number of logic channels.
The device supports setting the number of analog channels.

listitem.para: get: true if device has activated OVP, i.e. the output voltage exceeds the over-voltage protection threshold.
get: true if device has activated OCP, i.e. the current current exceeds the over-current protection threshold.

briefdescription.para: Choice of clock edge for external clock ("r" or "f").
Amplitude of a source without strictly-defined MQ.
Channel regulation get: "CV", "CC" or "UR", denoting constant voltage, constant current or unregulated.

detaileddescription.para: "CC-" denotes a power supply in current sink mode (e.g. HP 66xxB). "" is used when there is no regulation, e.g. the output is disabled.

briefdescription.para: Which external clock source to use if the device supports multiple external clock channels.
Offset of a source without strictly-defined MQ.
The device supports setting a pattern for the logic trigger.
Logic threshold: predefined levels (TTL, ECL, CMOS, etc).
The measurement range of a DMM or the output range of a power supply.

detaileddescription.para: for a DMM).

briefdescription.para: Duty cycle of a source signal.
The device supports specifying a capturefile to inject.
The device supports specifying the capturefile unit size.

detaileddescription.para: If not present, acquisition from the device is always "live", i.e. acquisition starts when the frontend asks and the results are sent out as soon as possible.
If present, it indicates that either the device has no live acquisition capability (for example a pure data logger), or there is a choice. sr_config_list() returns those choices.
In any case if a device has live acquisition capabilities, it is always the default.

briefdescription.para: The device supports setting a probe factor.
Number of powerline cycles for ADC integration time.
The device supports setting a sample time limit (how long the sample acquisition should run, in ms).
The device supports setting a sample number limit (how many samples should be acquired).
The device supports setting a frame limit (how many frames should be acquired).

detaileddescription.para: Neither a time limit nor a sample number limit has to be supplied, it will just acquire samples continuously, until explicitly stopped by a certain command.

briefdescription.para: The device has internal storage, into which data is logged.

detaileddescription.para: This starts or stops the internal logging.

briefdescription.para: Device instance type for USB devices.
Device instance type for serial port devices.
Device instance type for SCPI devices.
Device instance type for Modbus devices.
Types of device instance, struct sr_dev_inst.type.
The device instance was not found.
The device instance was found, but is still booting.
The device instance is live, but not in use.
The device instance is actively in use in a session.
The device is winding down its session.

memberdef.definition: typedef int(* sr_receive_data_callback) (int fd, int revents, void *cb_data)
memberdef.name: sr_receive_data_callback

briefdescription.para: Type definition for callback function for data reception.
The public libsigrok header file to be used by frontends.

detaileddescription.para: This is the only file that libsigrok users (frontends) are supposed to use and #include. There are other header files which get installed with libsigrok, but those are not meant to be used directly by frontends.
The correct way to get/use the libsigrok API functions is:
